households.residency¶

Household classification functions based on residency and kinship.

This module implements definitions of household types, which relate residency to kinship to define the coresident group based on relations. This includes Laslett’s 5-type typology as well as other definitions of households.

Most of the functions at present rely on the Cambridge Group typology for cross-cultural analysis, but are present in their most cited and simplest forms. A future expansion for this package would be to break these definitions into a subpackage of their own (e.g., residency.cambridge, residency.dukamakura, etc.)

See Also¶

kinship

The module that determines social relations regardless of residency.

residency.count_married(house)¶

Count the number of couples in a house.

houseHouse

A house object to examine for coresident married couples.

int

The number of coresident married couples.

residency.get_married(house)¶

Return which persons are married in a household.

houseHouse

A house object to examine for coresident married persons.

list of Person

A list of the coresident married persons in a house.

residency.is_solitary(house)¶

Return whether the household is occupied by a solitary individual.

houseHouse

The house object to examine.

bool

Whether the house is occupied by a single individual.

residency.is_no_family(house)¶

Return whether the hosuehold is a ‘no-family’ type.

houseHouse

The house object to examine.

bool

Whether the house contains a ‘no-family’ type household.

residency.is_nuclear(house)¶

Return whether the household is a single nuclear family w/o a prior generation.

houseHouse

The house object to examine.

bool

Whether the house contains a single nuclear family.

residency.is_extended(house)¶

Returns whether the house is a single extended family.

The extended family is defined as a nuclear family plus one member of an older generation.

houseHouse

The house object to examine.

bool

Whether the house contains an extended family household.

residency.is_multiple(house)¶

Whether the house is a multiple family household.

The multiple family type is defined by the presence of two or more nuclear families cohabitating.

houseHouse

The house object to examine.

bool

Whether the house contains a multiple family household.

residency.plot_classify(houses)¶

Classify houses at the present moment into their Cambridge Group typology.

Uses matplotlib.pyplot to create a bargraph of the current classification of households. Ignores empty houses (!).

houseslist of House

A list of houses to classify, most easily a community.houses attribute.
